Cambridge University have made the complete works of Darwin available online:
 
 http://darwin-online.org.uk/

Cambridge University have made the complete works of Darwin available online:
 
 http://darwin-online.org.uk/

 
 There has been a site online where the page are arranged as in the original so they are citable:
 
 http://pages.britishlibrary.net/charles.darwin/
 
 This new site seems different only in that they add Darwin's journals.
 
 Of course, both sites remove the excuse of creationists who post for not reading Darwin. They don't even have to go to a library anymore.

Another resource is the writings on Stephen Jay Gould are online. The website is being developed but I suspect since Stephen Gould is a target of misquotes, it might come in handy 
 
 http://www.sjgarchive.org/
